sen.j: 網野駅（あみのえき）は、京都府京丹後市網野町にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Amino-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Amino Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Amino Station, located in Amino-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Amino Station, located in Amino-cho, Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 島式・相対式2面3線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, with two island/opposite platforms serving three tracks.
It is situated at the ground level, with two island/opposite platforms serving three tracks.
It is situated at the ground level, with an island platform serving two tracks as well as a platform serving a tracks.
sen.cmt: 網野駅のホーム構造をサイトを参考にし、このようにいたしました。（参考：http://www.ktr-tetsudo.jp/route-station/amino_st.html

sen.j: 駅舎は、海に浮かぶヨットがモチーフ。
sen.e: The motif of the station house is a yacht floating on the sea.
The motif of the station house is a yacht coursing through the sea.
The motif of the station house is a yacht coursing through the sea.

sen.j: 出改札業務は、地元の網野町観光協会の係員に委託されている。
sen.e: The ticket-related job is entrusted to officers at the Amino-cho tourist association.
The ticket-related work is entrusted to officers at the Amino-cho Tourist Association.
The ticket-related work is entrusted to officers at the Amino-cho Tourist Association.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約356人である。
sen.e: The number of persons getting on board at this station is approx. 356 a day in the fiscal 2006.
In fiscal 2006, the average daily number of persons who boarded trains at this station was 356.
In fiscal year 2006, the average daily number of persons who boarded trains at this station was 356.

sen.j: 海水浴場が多いこともあって、夏場の賑わいが際立つ。
sen.e: With many bathing beaches located around, this station is thronged with lots of persons particularly in the summer.
With many bathing beaches located in the vicinity, this station buzzed with activity, particularly in the summer.
With many bathing beaches located in the vicinity, this station buzzed with activity, particularly in the summer.

sen.j: 冬場もカニを食べに来る人で賑わう。
sen.e: Many people also use this station in the winter to eat crab.
Many people also use this station during the winter months, as they come to eat crab.
Many people also use this station during the winter months, as they come to eat crab.

sen.j: ここを通るすべての特急が停車する。
sen.e: All limited express train on the line stop at this station.
All limited express trains on the line stop at this station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1926年（昭和元年）12月25日 - 国鉄峰豊線峰山～網野間が開業。
sen.e: December 25: 1926 - Japan National Railways started its operation between Mineyama and Amino on the Minetoyo Line, which was operated by Japan National Railways.
December 25, 1926: Japan National Railways started operating between Mineyama and Amino on the Minetoyo Line, which was run by Japan National Railways.
December 25, 1926: Japan National Railways started operating between Mineyama and Amino on the Minetoyo Line, which was run by Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）8月10日 - 峰山線・峰豊線を宮津線に改称。
sen.e: Ausgust 10, 1932 - Minetoyo Line and Mineyama Line were renamed as the Miyazu Line.
Ausgust 10, 1932: The Minetoyo and Mineyama lines were renamed as the Miyazu Line.
August 10, 1932: The Minetoyo and Mineyama lines were renamed as the Miyazu Line.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privitization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: It became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privitization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: It became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 - 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1990 - The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of the railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of the railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of the railway company.

sen.j: 第2回近畿の駅百選に選定されている。
sen.e: This station was selected in the second event for a selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
This station was chosen in the second event to select 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
This station was chosen in the second event to select 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
